title: Performance Issue Report: Firefox Unresponsive with High Memory Usage on macOS
content:
Dear Firefox Support Team,

I am writing to report an issue I‚Äôve been experiencing with Firefox on my MacBook Air (M3, 8GB RAM). Recently, Firefox has been becoming unresponsive quite often, and the Activity Monitor shows significantly high memory usage. For context, I typically have two Firefox windows running simultaneously, with approximately 5 tabs open in each window (10 tabs total). This is when I notice the performance degradation and high memory usage.

To help you investigate, I‚Äôve attached:

  • A screenshot of the memory usage in Activity Monitor when Firefox is running.
  • A screenshot of the extensions currently enabled in Firefox.

I am open to suggestions, such as disabling or removing certain extensions if they might be causing conflicts. However, I wanted to report this issue first to understand if this is a known problem or if there are optimizations planned for Firefox on Apple Silicon Macs.

Let me know if you need additional details, such as Firefox version, macOS version, or specific steps to reproduce the issue. I‚Äôd be happy to provide any information that can help resolve this.

Thank you for your time and assistance. I look forward to your response.

Best regards, Hemant

title: Firefox Flatpak unable to load Google.com (infinite loading loop) on Pop!_OS
content:
I am experiencing an issue where Google.com (other google domains work fine) will not load in Firefox, resulting in an infinite loading loop. Other browsers on the same system (Brave) work fine.

Here are the steps I have already tried:

Reinstalled Firefox completely

Removed Firefox via sudo apt remove --purge firefox -y

Cleared all user profiles and caches: ~/.mozilla/firefox, ~/.cache/mozilla, ~/.config/Mozilla

Reinstalled via Flatpak

Tested network connectivity outside Firefox

curl google.com works correctly

DNS resolution works via getent hosts google.com in the host system

Checked proxy settings

Ensured ‚ÄúNo proxy‚Äù is selected in Firefox ‚Üí did not resolve the issue

Tested in Safe Mode (disabling extensions)

Problem persists, so not caused by extensions

Tried disabling IPv6 inside Firefox

network.dns.disableIPv6 set to true ‚Üí no effect

Cleared DNS cache inside Firefox

about:networking#dns ‚Üí clicked ‚ÄúClear DNS Cache‚Äù ‚Üí no effect

Disabled DNS-over-HTTPS (Secure DNS)

about:preferences#privacy ‚Üí ‚ÄúUse secure DNS‚Äù ‚Üí disabled ‚Üí no effect

Disabled HTTP/3 (QUIC)

network.http.http3.enabled set to false ‚Üí no effect

Verified Flatpak network permissions

flatpak info --show-permissions org.mozilla.firefox shows network access allowed

Inside the Flatpak shell:

flatpak run --command=sh org.mozilla.firefox getent hosts google.com

‚Üí returns only IPv6 address: 2800:3f0:4001:839::200e google.com
creator: starmishima

title: Why do I have to provide so much personal information when making a donation to Mozilla?
content:
Is it possible to make a donation to Mozilla without providing so much personal information? I got a message on Firefox today asking for a donation, but when I tried to do that, I was asked for my home address. It's a general rule of internet marketing that people who use the internet would rather do anything than pay for something, so it's bad psychology to impose unnecessary conditions when you're asking for a donation. I don't have to provide my home address when I make donations to other organisations, so why does Mozilla need my home address? I apologize if this is the wrong place to ask this question, but I can't find anywhere else to ask it!

Thanks,

Shaun.
creator: shaunrrawlings

title: Mozilla Firefox Crashed: Gah. Your tab just crashed
content:
We are experiencing an ongoing issue with Firefox that persists even after performing the following troubleshooting steps: - Uninstalled Firefox completely. - Removed all browser add-ons and extensions. - Reinstalled the latest version of Firefox. Despite these steps, the issue still occurs: Browser crashes, pages not loading, extension not working. Additional Information: - Operating System: Windows 11 Pro - Firefox Version: 145.0.1 - Error Message:

We would appreciate guidance on resolving this problem, as standard troubleshooting has not resolved it.

Thank you in advance for your assistance. Kind regards, Edward

title: Roblox
content:
Hello there,

Thank you for getting back to us.

Please try the steps listed in the General Roblox Website Issues help article starting with the ‚ÄúClear your Temporary Internet Files and Cookies‚Äù section.

If you are still experiencing this error, please check your email‚Äôs inbox in case you‚Äôre seeing any password reset emails from our website. Make sure that you have checked your spam/junk folders for the email message. Also, add password_reset@roblox.com and @appmail.roblox.com to your email address permitted list. You may want to check your email provider‚Äôs help guide for specific instructions on ensuring that you receive emails from a particular address or domain.
